text.rei.support.me: Support me to continue making REI better!
text.rei.support.me.desc:
As a patreon supporter of REI, you get to use the latest version of REI for Minecraft snapshots.
Alternatively, you can also support me financially through renting a BisectHosting server.

%s
%s

Missing stages: %s
If this does not go away,
try looking for support with the logs!
This makes slots that does not match
the search filter gray.
Double click the search bar to toggle this mode.

You just removed a favorite entry!
You can add it back by clicking the + button over here!

Do you wish to enable the JEI compatibility layer %s§7?
§7It would allow loading JEI plugins from these sources:
%s

§7However REI's JEI Compatibility is not perfect, and issues may prevail.
§cUSE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
text.rei.crash.title: REI Crashed!
text.rei.crash.description:
§cRoughly Enough Item just experienced a crash during "%s".

§fDetails of the crashed are displayed below. Please identify the mod that caused the crash and report it to the mod author, alongside the crash log provided below.

If you believe this crash is caused by a bug in Roughly Enough Item, please report it to our issue tracker.

§6Thanks for your help!
text.rei.changelog.title: REI Changelog
text.rei.collapsible.entries.title: Collapsible Entries
text.rei.collapsible.entries.custom.name: Name:
tooltip.rei.drag_to_add_favorites: §7Drag this up to add this to your favorites!
config.roughlyenoughitems.title: Roughly Enough Items Config
config.rei.options.appearance.theme.desc: The global theme of Roughly Enough Items. This will be applied everywhere, including background, buttons, etc.
config.rei.options.appearance.recipe_bor: The border of each recipe. Default is the preferred REI look.
config.rei.options.appearance.reduced_mo: Disables animation for transitions, menus, hover states, to minimize discomfort caused by vestibular motion triggers.
config.rei.options.appearance.recipe_loo: The style of how recipes are displayed. Classic is the default look, while Composite is for the more informative, villger-like look.
config.rei.options.appearance.append_mod: Appends the containing namespace for entries. The appended line will be in italisised light blue.
config.rei.options.appearance.append_fav: Shows a hint on how to favorite an entry, or a recipe.
config.rei.options.keybinds.copy_recipe_: Copy a recipe's identifier by pressing the keybind, while hovering over a recipe's info button (shown with "+", or "?").
config.rei.options.keybinds.export_image: Export a recipe as an image by pressing the keybind, while hovering over a recipe.
config.rei.options.keybinds.back.desc: Quickly navigate back to the previous recipes by pressing the keybind.
config.rei.options.keybinds.use_native_k:
Instead of listing the keybindings in this configuration menu, create vanilla Minecraft-like keybinds in the Controls screen. Restarting Minecraft is required to disable this option.
Note that Minecraft-like keybinds suffer from conflicts and lack of support for modifier keys (Fabric).
config.rei.options.cheats.mode.desc: Cheats mode allows you to grab items from the side. This requires operator permission. The /give command would be used as a fallback if REI is not installed on the server.
config.rei.options.cheats.method.desc: The way how cheating is achieved. Grab mode places the cheated item at your cursor, while give mode places the cheated item in your inventory.
config.rei.options.cheats.amount.desc: The amount of items cheated. By default, REI cheats 1 item and a stack when clicked with shift.
config.rei.options.cheats.give_command.d: The command invoked to cheat items when REI is not installed on the server. This may be useful if the server replaced the default /give command. Available placeholders: {item_name}, {item_identifier}, {count} and {player_name}.
config.rei.options.layout.search_field_l: The location of the search field. By default, the search field is placed at the bottom center, which automatically moves to the side to make way for tall container screens.
config.rei.options.layout.config_button_: The location of the configuration button. By default, it is placed next to the search field. However, this can be changed to look like the legacy versions of REI, where it is placed on the top side of the screen.
config.rei.options.layout.craftable_filt: Craftable Filter allows you to view stacks currently craftable with the ingredients in your inventory. This can be useful alongside the Ctrl+Click quick craft feature to craft quickly.
config.rei.options.layout.boundaries.des: Declare the boundaries of the panel. Useful to limit the columns / rows displayed on screen.
config.rei.options.layout.location.desc: Change the location of the panel. The entire REI setup may be mirrored horizontally, including the list and all widgets.
config.rei.options.layout.hide_when_idle: Hide the panel when search is not active.
config.rei.options.accessibility.larger_: Increase the size of tabs in recipe viewing screens.
Increase the size of pages switching buttons next to tabs in recipe viewing screens.
config.rei.options.accessibility.clickab: Click on recipe arrows to see all recipes in the target category.
config.rei.options.accessibility.vanilla: Toggle the vanilla recipe book. This option is not designed for Modpack developers, as users should be the one to decide whether to use the vanilla recipe book.
config.rei.options.accessibility.status_: The location of the status effects. By vanilla, the status effects are placed on the right, but this can be changed to the left.
config.rei.options.favorites.mode.desc:
Favorite different entries on the opposite side of the entry panel. The favorites are persistent across reloads, and act as a quick access to things you are working on.
Simply press "A", or drag and drop entries to add / remove an entry from favorites.
config.rei.options.favorites.new_favorit: The visibility of the new favorites button on the bottom side of the panel.
config.rei.options.favorites.game_mode_c: The command invoked to change the gamemode. This may be useful if the server replaced the default /gamemode command. Available placeholders: {gamemode}.
config.rei.options.favorites.time_comman: The command invoked to change the time. This may be useful if the server replaced the default /time command. Available placeholders: {time}.
config.rei.options.favorites.weather_com: The command invoked to change the weather. This may be useful if the server replaced the default /weather command. Available placeholders: {weather}.
config.rei.options.performance.batched_r: Batched Rendering decreases the amount of individual calls, and improves performances where many entries are visible at one time.
config.rei.options.performance.cached_re: Cached Rendering pre-renders entries and avoids rendering the entries again. This will make animated entries appear static, but will drastically improve performance by 3x-5x.
config.rei.options.performance.reload_th: By using its own thread by default for reloading, this prevents soft-locking the game until everything is loaded in.
config.rei.options.performance.cached_di: Cached Display Lookup reduces the time when looking up a display. This stores the inputs and outputs of a display ahead of time.
config.rei.options.search.syntax_highlig: Displays different search filters in different colors for easier identification.
config.rei.options.search.mod_search.des: Filter entries by its containing mod §l%s§r.
config.rei.options.search.tooltip_search: Filter entries by contents of its tooltip §l%s§r. This is useful for searching through details of the entry, for example, enchantments.
config.rei.options.search.tag_search.des: Filter entries by the tags it is contained in §l%s§r.
config.rei.options.search.async_search.d: Parallelize search with multiple threads. This usually improves performance and "snappiness" of search.
config.rei.options.filtering.customized_: Create filtering rules to hide / show specific entries from the entry list.
config.rei.options.filtering.filter_disp: Apply filtering rules to determine the visibility of displays. Displays with all entries filtered will be hidden.
config.rei.options.filtering.merge_displ: Merge displays with the same recipe. This is useful for unifying recipes.
config.rei.options.list.display_mode.des: The way entries are laid out. Paginated mode displays entries in pages, where there are buttons to traverse the different pages. Scrolled mode displays entries in a vertical list.
config.rei.options.list.ordering.desc: The method the entries are sorted by. By default, REI follows the order in which entries are registered into the game. This can be changed to mimic the creative tabs or the direction of the sorting.
config.rei.options.list.zoom.desc: The size of the entries. Increasing the zoom amount may also improve performance as less entries are on the screen at the same time.
config.rei.options.list.focus_mode.desc: How the focus state of the entries will be presented. By default, REI follows vanilla and highlights the slot.
config.rei.options.list.collapsible_entr: Collapsible Entries allows you to group entries together, and expand / collapse them. This is useful for organizing entries, and hiding entries you do not need.
config.rei.options.debug.plugins_perform: Detailed break-down of plugins' reload times. This is very useful in debugging the performance after loaded into a world.
config.rei.options.debug.search_performa: Verbose console print out for analysing search performance.
config.rei.options.debug.entry_list_perf: Display the time used to render entries on the entry list.
Resets the current loaded data and reload all data and plugins.
config.rei.options.reset.reload_search.d: Resets all cache around search. The search cache will rebuild before the first search after reloading.
config.rei.options.reset.reset_all_optio: This is an extremely destructive operation. This resets all REI options as the factory state, and cannot be reversed.
